qas.question: At what event was Kinect announced?
What was the secret code name for Kinect while in development?
How can users utilize the Kinect to interact with their 360 consoles?

answers.text: by using gestures, spoken commands and presented objects and images

qas.question: What was the codename for Project Natal?

plausible_answers.text: Robbie Bach and Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer

qas.question: Whose speech first introduced the Kinect?

plausible_answers.text: a USB and mains power adapter

qas.question: What prevents older models from working with the Kinect?
Where was the CES 2010 keynote speech?

context: <b5_0>Kinect<b5_0/> is <a0_0>a "controller-free gaming and entertainment experience"<a0_0/> for the Xbox 360. It was first announced on <a1_0>June 1, 2009<a1_0/> at the <a2_0><b9_0>Electronic Entertainment Expo<b9_0/><a2_0/>, under the codename, <a3_0>Project Natal<a3_0/>. The add-on peripheral enables users to control and interact with the Xbox 360 without a game controller <a4_0>by using gestures, spoken commands and presented objects and images<a4_0/>. The Kinect accessory is compatible with all Xbox 360 models, connecting to new models via a custom connector, and to older ones via <b8_0>a USB and mains power adapter<b8_0/>. During their CES 2010 keynote speech, <b7_0>Robbie Bach and <b6_0>Microsoft CEO<b6_0/> Steve Ballmer<b7_0/> went on to say that Kinect will be released during the holiday period (November–January) and it will work with every 360 console. Its name and release date of 2010-11-04 were officially announced on 2010-06-13, prior to Microsoft's press conference at E3 2010.
